snippet: Galvanized by the brutality of Islamist militants, the United Nations Security Council appeared set to approve a resolution aimed at severely weakening them.
abstract: United Nations Security Council seems poised to unanimously approve resolution aimed at severely weakening Islamist militants by choking their sources of money, weapons and foreign recruits; resolution places half-dozen of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria leaders on international blacklist that will ban them from travel and freeze their assets; also threatens sanctions against their recruiters and financiers.
lead_paragraph: Galvanized by the brutality of Islamist militants, the United Nations Security Council appeared set to approve a resolution aimed at severely weakening them.

headline.main: U.N. Pursues Bid to Stifle Rebels in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.N. Pursues Bid to Stifle Rebels in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
